intro: Syrenia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf syrenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and wetlands. Syrenia latifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities.
